text_overlay: Make good music = skip the line
posts.caption:
Transparency is everything üè≠

We don't pick favorites. We don't play politics. We let the ratings decide.

Here's exactly how it works:

üìù Artists submit tracks
üéß Community rates them (Hook + Production)
üìä High-rated tracks move up the queue
üé¨ Top tracks get featured on the YouTube channel
üèÜ Factory Certified tracks (90+) get special promotion

It's pure meritocracy. The crowd decides what's good.

No paying for playlist placements. No begging influencers for features. No gaming the algorithm.

Just make music people love, and the factory will recognize it.

That's the deal.

#FrequencyFactory #MusicDiscovery #IndieMusic #AROperative #UnsignedArtist #NewMusic #Transparent #FairPlay

script.hook_0_3sec: "Unpopular opinion: Hook matters more than production."
script.argument_3_12sec:
[B-roll of successful "low-fi" hits]
"You can have a Grammy-level mix but if the hook doesn't stick in 10 seconds, nobody cares."
"Meanwhile, a catchy hook with decent production? That's a hit."

text_overlay: This is the hill I die on
posts.caption:
I said what I said üè≠

At Frequency Factory, we rate two things:

üé£ Hook Strength
üéõÔ∏è Production Quality

And here's what the data shows: Tracks with high hook ratings (9+) but medium production (7-8) get certified MORE often than tracks with medium hooks but perfect production.

Why?

Because people remember melodies, not EQ curves.
They hum hooks, not compression ratios.
They share catchy, not technically perfect.

Production matters. Don't get me wrong. But the hook is king.

If I have to pick between:
- Track A: Hook 9/10, Production 7/10
- Track B: Hook 7/10, Production 9/10

I'm betting on Track A every time.

That's the hill I die on.

Change my mind in the comments.

#FrequencyFactory #HotTake #MusicProduction #AROperative #MusicTheory #Hooks #Production #MusicDebate #MusicDiscovery
posts.engagement_prompt: Hook or Production - what matters more to YOU? üëá
posts.expected_reach: Very High - Controversial takes drive debate + shares

posts.caption:
üö® WEEKEND CHALLENGE ALERT üö®

This weekend only: DOUBLE TOKEN WEEKEND üè≠

Here's the deal:

üéØ Rate 20+ tracks between Friday 5pm and Sunday 11:59pm
üí∞ Earn DOUBLE tokens for every rating
üèÜ Top 10 raters get exclusive "Weekend Warrior" badge
ü•á #1 rater gets featured in Monday's YouTube video

But here's the catch: Your ratings have to be ACCURATE. 

We track rating consistency against community averages. If you're just spam-clicking random numbers, you get disqualified.

This is about quality + quantity.

Why we do this:
- Artists submit more tracks on weekends
- We need extra hands to keep the queue moving
- Weekends are when people have time to really dig in
- We want to reward the dedicated operatives

Ready to grind?

üëâ Clock in via link in bio
‚è∞ Challenge ends Sunday 11:59pm EST
üí™ Let's see what you got

instagram_specific_best_practices.posting_times: Test 9am, 12pm, 5-6pm, 8-9pm EST - adjust based on your analytics

instagram_specific_best_practices.reel_tips: Hook in 3 seconds, text overlays essential, use trending audio
instagram_specific_best_practices.story_strategy: Post behind-scenes 3-5x daily, use polls and questions stickers
instagram_specific_best_practices.bio_optimization: Clear value prop + CTA + link to platform
